[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: SeekKeyCodec] [Seek prefix injection] Can encode_seek_key() on line 118 be exploited with crafted prefixes to seek to unintended database ranges, accessing restricted validator or consensus data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: SeekKeyCodec] [Seek key collision] Can different SeekKey types produce identical encoded seek keys, causing range queries to return incorrect data from other schemas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: SeekKeyCodec] [Out of bounds seek] Can encode_seek_key() produce byte sequences that seek beyond intended column family boundaries, potentially reading data from other schemas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Blanket implementation: SeekKeyCodec] [Inconsistent delegation] Does the blanket implementation on lines 122-131 guarantee that SeekKeyCodec::encode_seek_key() delegates to KeyCodec::encode_key() without transformation, or can this cause seek operations to fail silently? [File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Blanket implementation: SeekKeyCodec] [Infinite recursion] Can the blanket impl create recursive trait resolution if a type implements both SeekKeyCodec and KeyCodec with different semantics, causing compiler errors or runtime failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: Schema] [Lifetime safety] Does the 'static bound on line 135 properly ensure Schema types outlive all database operations, or can dropped schemas cause use-after-free in concurrent database access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: Schema] [Send/Sync violation] Can the Send + Sync bounds be bypassed through unsafe code, allowing non-thread-safe schemas to corrupt database state in concurrent validator operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: Schema] [Associated type confusion] Can associated types Key and Value be assigned incompatible types that violate database invariants, such as using transaction hashes as validator addresses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Trait: Schema] [Orphan schema] Can schemas be defined without proper KeyCodec/ValueCodec implementations, causing compilation to succeed but runtime database operations to fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_encode_decode] [Roundtrip failure] Does assert_encode_decode() on lines 153-164 catch all encoding inconsistencies, or can subtle bugs allow key/value pairs to encode/decode to different values causing state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_encode_decode] [Equality bypass] Can the PartialEq implementation used on lines 157 and 162 be manipulated to pass assert_encode_decode tests while actual encoded bytes differ, hiding serialization bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_encode_decode] [Missing validation] Does assert_encode_decode() validate that encoded bytes are canonical (minimal representation), or can multiple encodings for the same value cause merkle root inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_encode_decode] [Expect unwrap] Can the .expect() calls on lines 155, 156, 160, 161 hide panics in production code if encoding/decoding fails during actual validator operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_no_panic_decoding] [Panic bypass] Does assert_no_panic_decoding() on lines 167-171 truly prevent all panics, or can specially crafted byte sequences trigger panics in decode_key or decode_value causing validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_no_panic_decoding] [Unused result suppression] Does the #[allow(unused_must_use)] attribute on line 167 hide critical errors in decoding that should fail loudly rather than silently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/schemadb/src/schema.rs] [Function: assert_no_panic_decoding] [Resource exhaustion] Can assert_no_panic_decoding() detect memory exhaustion attacks where decode operations allocate unbounded memory without panicking? (High)
